## Data Cleaning and Preparation
This section will clean the Nobel Prize dataset by renaming columns, removing unnecessary data, and preparing the text for further analysis.


# Load necessary libraries
library(tidyverse)
library(lubridate)

# Read the CSV file
nobel_data <- read_csv("nobel-prize-winners.csv", show_col_types = FALSE)

# Data Cleaning Process
nobel_cleaned <- nobel_data %>%
  drop_na(motivation) %>%  # Remove rows with missing motivation text
  distinct() %>%  # Remove duplicate rows
  rename(
    laureate_name = name,
    motivation_text = motivation,
    birth_country = bornCountry_now,
    birth_city = bornCity_now,
    birth_year = born,
    death_year = died,
    category = category,
    award_year = year
  ) %>%
  mutate(
    award_year = as.integer(award_year),
    birth_year = year(as.Date(birth_year, format = "%Y-%m-%d")),
    death_year = year(as.Date(death_year, format = "%Y-%m-%d")),
    laureate_name = str_trim(laureate_name),  # Remove extra whitespace
    gender = str_to_lower(gender)  # Convert gender text to lowercase
  )

# Display cleaned data summary
glimpse(nobel_cleaned)
